nodes.bodyText: Correct way of documenting fields https://dart.dev/guides/language/effective-dart/documentation#doc-comments
This fixes not setting null value on properties that don't have default value. Dart is evolving to non-null by default language, so this will be important in the next releases of the language.
I think there might be something wrong
template needs updatinb
I started looking into it, but decided this is too far from scope of this MR. Might look into it later, for now I reverted the change for dio and jaguar.
Quick question: should this be null instead of "null" similar to https://github.com/OpenAPITools/openapi-generator/pull/6729/files#r446676527 ?
This is in template DartDio - a webframework I don't know, so I made this change backwards compatible for the framework, as they use int x=  null. Pure dart2 generator will not have default null.
Same thing in DartJaguar, backwards compatible template.
Would this be an issue? Should it be just int id; ?
That's also what I said in my comment
ah ok, dart1 template is broken now :( sorry, haven't noticed it

that would mean dart1 is not being tested but code generator is released and considered stable.
What's your approach to dead-code generators @wing328 ?
Candidate for removal or improvement?
I fixed it per your comment. I dont know how to reproduce your results, CircleCI also produces same code as was on my side, unreliable test/environment?

dart2 uses the petstore.yaml for tests but pestore.yaml only covers the very basic test cases. Fake Petstore contains a lot more test cases, which should cover this particular issue.
For my findings above, I was using https://github.com/geoDavey/osrm-openapi/blob/master/osrm-openapi.yaml suggested by @sbu-WBT
Updated using your file @sbu-WBT
@agilob would it be better to throw an error rather than returning null?
Why would this be better?
I actually convinced myself that if enum value is not known, project should be regenerated, but crashing whole deserialisation seems too brutal too. Reverted it.

Why would this be better?

The user won't be notified of the issue (incorrect enum value).
(null could be a possible value in the enum but don't think the Dart client supports it at the moment)
